Uses of Interface
org.apache.mesos.ExecutorDriver

  • Packages that use ExecutorDriver 
    Package Description
    org.apache.mesos  

    • Uses of ExecutorDriver in org.apache.mesos

      Classes in org.apache.mesos that implement ExecutorDriver 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  MesosExecutorDriver
      Concrete implementation of an ExecutorDriver that connects an Executor with a Mesos slave.
      Methods in org.apache.mesos with parameters of type ExecutorDriver 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Executor.disconnected(ExecutorDriver driver)
      Invoked when the executor becomes "disconnected" from the slave (e.g., the slave is being restarted due to an upgrade).
      void Executor.error(ExecutorDriver driver, String message)
      Invoked when a fatal error has occurred with the executor and/or executor driver.
      void Executor.frameworkMessage(ExecutorDriver driver, byte[] data)
      Invoked when a framework message has arrived for this executor.
      void Executor.killTask(ExecutorDriver driver, Protos.TaskID taskId)
      Invoked when a task running within this executor has been killed (via SchedulerDriver.killTask(org.apache.mesos.Protos.TaskID)).
      void Executor.launchTask(ExecutorDriver driver, Protos.TaskInfo task)
      Invoked when a task has been launched on this executor (initiated via SchedulerDriver.launchTasks(java.util.Collection<org.apache.mesos.Protos.OfferID>, java.util.Collection<org.apache.mesos.Protos.TaskInfo>, org.apache.mesos.Protos.Filters).
      void Executor.registered(ExecutorDriver driver, Protos.ExecutorInfo executorInfo, Protos.FrameworkInfo frameworkInfo, Protos.SlaveInfo slaveInfo)
      Invoked once the executor driver has been able to successfully connect with Mesos.
      void Executor.reregistered(ExecutorDriver driver, Protos.SlaveInfo slaveInfo)
      Invoked when the executor re-registers with a restarted slave.
      void Executor.shutdown(ExecutorDriver driver)
      Invoked when the executor should terminate all of it's currently running tasks.
